query.result:
10 This was the reason that gave rise 11 to them speaking of me; and they began 12 to say: "That one does not seem a fictitious body";
13 then towards me, as much as they could get, 14 some made their way, always taking care 15 not to come out where they would not be burned.

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
16 «O tu che vai, non per esser più tardo, 17 ma forse reverente, a li altri dopo, 18 rispondi a me che ’n sete e ’n foco ardo.
query.result: "O you who go, not because you are slower, but perhaps out of reverence, behind the others, answer me, who burn in thirst and fire.

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
19 Né solo a me la tua risposta è uopo; 20 ché tutti questi n’hanno maggior sete 21 che d’acqua fredda Indo o Etïopo.

Please translate literally into English.
22 Dinne com’ è che fai di te parete 23 al sol, pur come tu non fossi ancora 24 di morte intrato dentro da la rete».
query.result: "Tell us how it is that you make yourself a wall to the sun, just as if you had not yet entered the net of death."

"Thus one of them spoke to me; and I would have already revealed myself, if I had not been intent on another new thing that appeared then;
for through the middle of the burning path came people with their faces towards this one, which made me pause to look."

"There I see on every side each shade becoming ready and kissing another without stopping, content with a brief greeting;
thus among their dark troop one ant sniffs another, perhaps to spy on their path and their fortune."

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
37 Tosto che parton l’accoglienza amica, 38 prima che ’l primo passo lì trascorra, 39 sopragridar ciascuna s’affatica:
40 la nova gente: «Soddoma e Gomorra»; 41 e l’altra: «Ne la vacca entra Pasife, 42 perché ’l torello a sua lussuria corra».
query.result:
"As soon as they break off their friendly greeting, before the first step is taken there, each one strives to outshout the other:
the new people: "Sodom and Gomorrah"; and the others: "Pasiphaë enters the cow, so that the bull may run to her lust"."

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
43 Poi, come grue ch’a le montagne Rife 44 volasser parte, e parte inver’ l’arene, 45 queste del gel, quelle del sole schife,
46 l’una gente sen va, l’altra sen vene; 47 e tornan, lagrimando, a’ primi canti 48 e al gridar che più lor si convene;
49 e raccostansi a me, come davanti, 50 essi medesmi che m’avean pregato, 51 attenti ad ascoltar ne’ lor sembianti.

55 non son rimase acerbe né mature 56 le membra mie di là, ma son qui meco 57 col sangue suo e con le sue giunture.
query.result:
"I, who had seen them pleased twice, began: "O souls certain of having, whenever it may be, a state of peace,
my limbs have not remained on the other side, either unripe or mature, but are here with me with his blood and with his joints.

query.prompt:

58 Quinci sù vo per non esser più cieco; 59 donna è di sopra che m’acquista grazia, 60 per che ’l mortal per vostro mondo reco.

Please translate literally into English.
61 Ma se la vostra maggior voglia sazia 62 tosto divegna, sì che ’l ciel v’alberghi 63 ch’è pien d’amore e più ampio si spazia,
64 ditemi, acciò ch’ancor carte ne verghi, 65 chi siete voi, e chi è quella turba 66 che se ne va di retro a’ vostri terghi».
query.result:
"But if your greatest desire is soon sated, so that Heaven may lodge you which is full of love and extends more widely,
tell me, so that I may still write it on paper, who you are, and who is that crowd that goes behind your backs."

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
67 Non altrimenti stupido si turba 68 lo montanaro, e rimirando ammuta, 69 quando rozzo e salvatico s’inurba,
70 che ciascun’ ombra fece in sua paruta; 71 ma poi che furon di stupore scarche, 72 lo qual ne li alti cuor tosto s’attuta,
73 «Beato te, che de le nostre marche», 74 ricominciò colei che pria m’inchiese, 75 «per morir meglio, esperïenza imbarche!
76 La gente che non vien con noi, offese 77 di ciò per che già Cesar, trïunfando, 78 “Regina” contra sé chiamar s’intese:
79 però si parton “Soddoma” gridando, 80 rimproverando a sé com’ hai udito, 81 e aiutan l’arsura vergognando.
query.result:
"No otherwise does the mountaineer become confused and bewildered, and, looking around, becomes speechless, when he, rude and wild, enters the city,
than each shade did in its appearance; but after they were relieved of their astonishment, which in lofty hearts is quickly calmed,
"Blessed are you, who from our regions", began again the one who had first questioned me, "embark on experience in order to die better!
The people who do not come with us offended for that for which once Caesar, triumphing, heard himself called "Queen" against his will:
therefore they depart shouting "Sodom", reproaching themselves as you have heard, and they help their burning by feeling ashamed.

query.result:
"Our sin was hermaphroditic; but because we did not observe human law, following our appetites like beasts,
in our disgrace, the name of her who became a beast in the bestial ruins is read, when you depart, for our sake.
